info.title: filez-server
info.description: API for managing files in MOWS Filez

200.description: Checks if the requested resources are available to this user

parameters.name: access_policy_id
parameters.description: The ID of the access policy to delete

parameters.name: access_policy_id
parameters.description: The ID of the access policy to retrieve

200.description: Gets a access policy by ID

parameters.name: file_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file group to delete

parameters.name: file_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file group to retrieve

200.description: Gets a file group by ID
Lists the files in a given group
Updates the members of a file group

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file to retrieve content for

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the file to retrieve, if left empty, the latest version will be returned

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: The ID of the application that uploaded the file, if left empty, the app id is the filez server itself

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: If set to true, the content disposition header will be set to attachment

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: If set, the cache control header will be set to public, max-age={c}

200.description: Gets a single files data/content from the server

206.description: Partial content returned due to range request

500.description: Internal server error retrieving file content

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file to check for upload status

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the file, if applicable

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: The ID of the application that uploaded the file, if left empty, the app id is the filez server itself

200.description: File exists and is ready to resume upload

400.description: Bad request, missing or invalid headers

412.description: Precondition failed due to missing or invalid Tus-Resumable header

patch.description: Patch a file version using the TUS protocol. The file and the file version must exist. If the file version is marked as verified it cannot be patched, unless the expected checksum is updated or removed.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file to patch

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the file to patch

400.description: Bad request, missing or invalid headers

412.description: Precondition failed, likely due to missing or invalid Tus-Resumable header

413.description: File version size exceeded, the size of the file version exceeds the allowed limit

415.description: Unsupported media type, Content-Type must be application/offset+octet-stream

500.description: Internal server error, unexpected error occurred while processing the request

post.description: Create a new file version entry in the database

201.description: Created a file version on the server

post.description: Delete file versions in the database

200.description: Deleted file versions on the server

post.description: Get file versions from the server

200.description: Got file versions from the server

post.description: Update file versions in the database

200.description: Updated file versions on the server

post.description: Create a new file entry in the database

200.description: Created a file on the server

post.description: Delete a file entry in the database

200.description: Deleted a file on the server

post.description: Update a file entry in the database

200.description: Updated a file on the server

post.description: Pickup a job from the server

200.description: Picked up a job from the server

post.description: Updates the status of a job on the server

200.description: Updated job status on the server

post.description: Create a new job in the database

200.description: Created a job on the server

post.description: Delete a job from the database

200.description: Deleted a job on the server

post.description: Get a job from the database

200.description: Got a job from the server

post.description: Update a job in the database

200.description: Updated a job on the server
Got the tags for the specified resources

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user group to delete

parameters.name: user_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user group to retrieve

200.description: Gets a user group by ID
Lists the users in a given group
Updates the members of a user group

context_app_ids.description: The IDs of the application this policy is associated with

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource this policy applies to, if no resource ID is provided, the policy is a type level policy, allowing for example the creation of a resource of that type.

context_app_ids.description: The IDs of the application this policy is associated with

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource this policy applies to, if no resource ID is provided, the policy is a type level policy, allowing for example the creation of a resource of that type.

content_expected_sha256_digest.description:
Optional SHA256 digest of the file content as a lowercase hexadecimal string.
Once the content is fully uploaded it automatically gets validated against this digest.
After successful validation, the versions content_valid field is set to true.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to create a version for.

extracted_data.description: Extracted data from the file, such as text content, metadata, etc.

private_app_data.description:
Place for apps to store custom data related to the file.
every app is identified by its id, and can only access its own data.

shared_app_data.description: Apps can provide and request shared app data from other apps on creation

app_id.description: The app that should handle the job

app_instance_last_seen_time.description:
The last time the app instance has been seen by the server
This is used to determine if the app instance is still alive and can handle the job

assigned_app_runtime_instance_id.description: After the job is picked up by the app, this field will be set to the app instance id, created from the kubernetes pod UUID and a random string that the app generates on startup

created_time.description: When the job was created in the database

deadline_time.description: After the deadline the job will be marked as finished and failed if not completed

end_time.description: When the job was finished, either successfully or failed

execution_information.description: Details relevant for the execution of the job

modified_time.description: When the job was last modified in the database

start_time.description: When the job was started, either automatically or manually

status.description: The current status of the job

external_user_id.description: The external user ID, e.g. from ZITADEL or other identity providers

pre_identifier_email.description: Used to create a user before the external user ID is known, when the user then logs in with a verified email address the email is switched to the external user ID

JobTypeCreatePreview.description: Allows the app to create a set of previews for a existing file_version_number and file_id

MowsApp.description:
# Backend Apps
Pods can authenticate as apps using their Kubernetes service account token
Backend apps can act on behalf of users by picking up jobs created by users
# Frontend Apps
Frontend Apps are recognized by their origin that is sent with the browser request
They can act on behalf of users if an access policy allows it

id.description: Unique identifier for the app in the database, this is used to identify the app in all database operations

name.description:
Name and Namespace of the app in Kubernetes
Renaming an app in Kubernetes will not change the name in the database but create a new app with the new name
Generally the name should not be changed, if it is it can be manually adjusted in the database

origins.description:
Origins are used to identify the app in the browser, all origins must be unique across all apps
If an app has no origins, it is considered a backend app

trusted.description: If a app is marked as trusted, it can access all resources without any restrictions
